ground_truth: She waves her wand. Harry blinks as his glasses repair themselves. She takes him to a bookshop where the Weasley family are standing near the counter. A queue of excited customers are waiting to get their book signed. A blond man with a blue suit and matching cloak appears. He smiles smugly. Posing for the camera, Lockhart spots Harry's grubby face in the crowd. The photographer pulls Harry forward. Ron pulls a face. They head for the door. A boy with very fair hair tears a page from a book. He steps in front of Harry. A man with long fair hair touches Harry's forehead with his snake-topped cane. The Grangers are chatting to Mr. Weasley. He looks at Ron. He takes a book from Jenny's cauldron. He slips two books back into Jenny's cauldron. Mr. Weasley smiles reassuringly at his children. Lucius turns on his heel. Draco glares at Ron and Harry. At King's Cross and Pancras Station, Harry and Louisa hurry along Platform 10 with loaded trolleys. The twins and Percy push their trolleys straight towards the brick wall between the two platforms. They disappear through it one after the other. Jenny follows. Mr. and Mrs. Weasley head for the wall. On Platform 10, Harry heads for the wall with Ron close behind. They hit solid brick. They collapse in a heap of trolleys and luggage. Hedwig flaps her wings. A porter comes over. Ron looks thoughtful. Outside the station, the blue Ford Anglia rises unsteadily into the air. A taxi driver looks up in amazement. Ron presses a button on the dashboard. High above London, the car disappears. Thick cloud gradually clears, revealing low green hills far below. The car suddenly reappears. Ron changes gear and steers the car down towards the railway line. They skim above the track over a magnificent stone viaduct. They look back with horror. The Hogwarts Express is right behind them. Ron jacks the wheel to the left. The car swerves away from the track and swoops under the viaduct. It tumbles between the stone arches, turning over and over. The car door flies open and Harry falls out. Harry has managed to grab the door handle. He hangs on precariously above the train. Ron stretches down towards him. Harry reaches desperately for his hand. Harry grabs Ron's outstretched hand and manages to scramble back inside the car. Ron turns the wheel. The train thunders on beneath a plume of white smoke. As darkness falls, the car headlights pick out the towers of Hogwarts School. Ron glances at Harry. Harry's smile of delight fades as the car engine falters. Ron struggles with the wheel as the car swoops out of control, zooming close to the brightly lit windows of the Great Hall.

A line of excited patrons are waiting to get their tome signed. A blond man with a blue suit and matching cloak appears. He smiles smugly. Lucius turns on his heel. Draco glares at Ron and Harry. At King's Cross and Pancras Station, Harry and Louisa hurry along Platform 10 with loaded carts. Outside the station, the blue Ford Anglia rises unsteadily into the air. A cab driver looks up in amazement. Ron presses a button on the dashboard. High above London, the automobile disappears. Thick cloud gradually clears, revealing low green hills far below. The automobile suddenly reappears. Ron shifts gear and steers the automobile down towards the railway line. They skim above the track over a magnificent stone viaduct. They look back with horror. The Hogwarts Express is right behind them. Ron jacks the wheel to the left. The automobile swerves away from the track and swoops under the viaduct. It tumbles between the stone arches, turning over and over. The automobile door flies open and Harry falls out. Harry has managed to grab the door handle. He hangs on precariously above the train. Ron stretches down towards him. Harry reaches desperately for his hand. Harry grabs Ron's outstretched hand and manages to scramble back inside the automobile. Ron turns the wheel. The train thunders on beneath a plume of white smoke. As darkness falls, the automobile headlights pick out the towers of Hogwarts School. Ron glances at Harry. Harry's smile of delight fades as the automobile engine falters. Ron struggles with the wheel as the automobile swoops out of control, zooming close to the brightly lit windows of the Great Hall.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She waves her wand, and Harry's glasses repair themselves. She takes him to a bookshop where the Weasley family stands near the counter. Excited customers queue for book signings. A blond man in a blue suit and cloak appears, smiling smugly. Lockhart spots Harry's grubby face and the photographer pulls Harry forward. Ron makes a face as they head for the door. A boy with fair hair tears a page from a book and steps in front of Harry. A man with long fair hair touches Harry's forehead with a snake-topped cane. The Grangers chat with Mr. Weasley, who smiles reassuringly at his children. Lucius turns on his heel, and Draco glares at Ron and Harry. At King's Cross Station, Harry and Louisa hurry along Platform 10 with trolleys. The twins and Percy push their trolleys through the wall between platforms, disappearing one by one. Jenny follows, and Mr. and Mrs. Weasley head for the wall. On Platform 10, Harry and Ron hit solid brick, collapsing in a heap. Hedwig flaps her wings as a porter approaches. Outside, the blue Ford Anglia rises into the air, astonishing a taxi driver. Ron presses a button, and the car disappears above London. Thick clouds clear, revealing green hills below. The car reappears, and Ron steers it towards the railway line, skimming above a stone viaduct. They look back in horror as the Hogwarts Express approaches. Ron swerves the car under the viaduct, tumbling between arches. The door flies open, and Harry falls out, grabbing the handle. He hangs precariously above the train, reaching for Ron's hand. Harry grabs Ron's hand and scrambles back inside. Ron turns the wheel as the train thunders beneath. As darkness falls, the car's headlights reveal Hogwarts. Ron glances at Harry, whose smile fades as the engine falters. Ron struggles with the wheel as the car swoops out of control, zooming close to the Great Hall's lit windows.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: She waves her wand, repairing Harry's glasses. They visit a bookshop where the Weasley family stands by the counter. Excited customers queue for book signings. A smug blond man in a blue suit, Lockhart, poses for the camera and notices Harry. The photographer pulls Harry forward, and Ron makes a face. As they leave, a fair-haired boy tears a page from a book and steps in front of Harry. A man with long hair touches Harry's forehead with a snake-topped cane. The Grangers chat with Mr. Weasley, who smiles at his children. Lucius turns away, and Draco glares at Ron and Harry. At King's Cross, Harry and Louisa hurry along Platform 10. The twins and Percy push trolleys through the wall, followed by Jenny and the Weasleys. Harry and Ron hit solid brick and collapse. Outside, the blue Ford Anglia rises into the air, disappearing above London. The car reappears, and Ron steers it above a viaduct. The Hogwarts Express is behind them. Ron swerves, and the car tumbles. Harry falls but grabs the door handle. Ron helps him back inside. The train thunders below. As darkness falls, the car approaches Hogwarts. Ron struggles with the wheel as the engine falters, zooming close to the Great Hall's windows.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
With a graceful flick of her wand, she performs a spell, and Harry blinks in surprise as his glasses magically repair themselves right before his eyes. She then guides him to a bustling bookshop, where the entire Weasley family is gathered near the counter. A long queue of eager and excited customers is waiting patiently, each hoping to get their book signed by the famous author. Suddenly, a blond man dressed in a striking blue suit with a matching cloak makes his appearance. He smiles with a smug expression, clearly enjoying the attention. As he poses confidently for the camera, Lockhart's eyes catch sight of Harry's slightly grubby face amidst the crowd. The photographer, eager for a good shot, pulls Harry forward. Ron, standing nearby, makes a face in response. They then make their way towards the door. Meanwhile, a boy with very fair hair tears a page from a book and steps boldly in front of Harry. A man with long, fair hair approaches and lightly touches Harry's forehead with his snake-topped cane. Nearby, the Grangers are engaged in a lively chat with Mr. Weasley. He glances over at Ron and then takes a book from Jenny's cauldron, discreetly slipping two books back into it. Mr. Weasley offers a reassuring smile to his children. Lucius, with a swift turn on his heel, departs. Draco, with a glare, directs his disdain at Ron and Harry. 

At King's Cross and Pancras Station, Harry and Louisa hurry along Platform 10, pushing their heavily loaded trolleys. The twins and Percy confidently push their trolleys straight towards the seemingly solid brick wall that separates the two platforms. One after the other, they disappear through it. Jenny follows closely behind. Mr. and Mrs. Weasley also head towards the wall. On Platform 10, Harry makes his way towards the wall with Ron following closely. However, they unexpectedly hit solid brick and collapse in a tangled heap of trolleys and luggage. Hedwig, startled, flaps her wings in agitation. A porter notices the commotion and comes over to assist. Ron, looking thoughtful, ponders their predicament. Outside the station, the blue Ford Anglia rises unsteadily into the air, catching the attention of a taxi driver who looks up in amazement. Ron, seated inside the car, presses a button on the dashboard. High above the sprawling city of London, the car suddenly disappears from view. As thick clouds gradually clear, they reveal the low, rolling green hills far below. The car reappears without warning. Ron quickly changes gear and steers the car downwards towards the railway line. They skim just above the track, soaring over a magnificent stone viaduct. Looking back in horror, they see the Hogwarts Express right behind them. Ron urgently jacks the wheel to the left, causing the car to swerve away from the track and swoop under the viaduct. It tumbles wildly between the stone arches, turning over and over. The car door flies open, and Harry finds himself falling out. Desperately, he manages to grab the door handle, hanging on precariously above the speeding train. Ron stretches down towards him, and Harry reaches out desperately for his hand. With a determined effort, Harry grabs Ron's outstretched hand and scrambles back inside the car. Ron turns the wheel with urgency. Below them, the train thunders on, leaving a plume of white smoke in its wake. As darkness descends, the car's headlights illuminate the majestic towers of Hogwarts School. Ron glances over at Harry, whose smile of delight quickly fades as the car engine begins to falter. Ron struggles with the wheel as the car swoops out of control, zooming dangerously close to the brightly lit windows of the Great Hall.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
With a graceful flick of her wand, she performs a spell with an elegant precision, and Harry blinks in surprise and amazement as his glasses magically repair themselves right before his very eyes. She then guides him toward a bustling and lively bookshop, where the entire Weasley family is gathered near the counter. A long queue of eager and excited customers is waiting patiently in line, each one hoping to get their cherished book signed by the famous author. Suddenly, a blond man dressed in a striking and eye-catching blue suit with a matching cloak makes his appearance. He smiles with a smug and self-satisfied expression, clearly enjoying all the attention directed towards him. As he poses confidently for the camera, Lockhart's eyes catch sight of Harry's slightly grubby face amidst the crowd. The photographer, eager and keen for a good shot, pulls Harry forward. Ron, standing nearby, makes a face in response to the situation. They then make their way toward the door. Meanwhile, a boy with very fair hair boldly tears a page from a book and steps right in front of Harry. A man with long, flowing fair hair approaches and lightly touches Harry's forehead with his snake-topped cane. Nearby, the Grangers are fully engaged in a lively and animated chat with Mr. Weasley. He takes a quick glance over at Ron and then discreetly takes a book from Jenny's cauldron, slipping two books back into it. Mr. Weasley offers a reassuring and supportive smile to his children. Lucius, with a swift and smooth turn on his heel, departs the scene. Draco, with a glare, directs his disdain and resentment at Ron and Harry. 

At King's Cross and Pancras Station, Harry and Louisa hurry along Platform 10, pushing their heavily loaded trolleys with a sense of urgency. The twins and Percy confidently push their trolleys straight towards the seemingly solid brick wall that separates the two platforms. One after the other, they disappear through it effortlessly. Jenny follows closely behind them. Mr. and Mrs. Weasley also head towards the mysterious wall. On Platform 10, Harry makes his determined way towards the wall with Ron following closely behind. However, they unexpectedly collide with the solid brick and collapse in a tangled heap of trolleys and luggage. Hedwig, startled by the sudden commotion, flaps her wings in agitation. A porter, noticing the commotion, comes over to assist them. Ron, looking thoughtful and pensive, ponders their predicament. Outside the station, the blue Ford Anglia rises unsteadily into the air, catching the attention of a taxi driver who looks up in astonishment and amazement. Ron, seated inside the car, presses a button on the dashboard. High above the sprawling city of London, the car suddenly disappears from view. As thick clouds gradually clear, they reveal the low, rolling green hills far below them. The car reappears without warning. Ron quickly changes gear and steers the car downwards towards the railway line. They skim just above the track, soaring over a magnificent stone viaduct. Looking back in horror, they see the Hogwarts Express right behind them. Ron urgently jacks the wheel to the left, causing the car to swerve away from the track and swoop under the viaduct. It tumbles wildly between the stone arches, turning over and over. The car door flies open, and Harry finds himself falling out. Desperately, he manages to grab the door handle, hanging on precariously above the speeding train. Ron stretches down towards him, and Harry reaches out desperately for his hand. With a determined and concerted effort, Harry grabs Ron's outstretched hand and scrambles back inside the car. Ron turns the wheel with urgency. Below them, the train thunders on, leaving a plume of white smoke in its wake. As darkness descends, the car's headlights illuminate the majestic towers of Hogwarts School. Ron glances over at Harry, whose smile of delight quickly fades as the car engine begins to falter. Ron struggles with the wheel as the car swoops out of control, zooming dangerously close to the brightly lit windows of the Great Hall.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She waves her wand with a graceful flick, and Harry blinks in surprise as he watches his glasses magically repair themselves, the cracks vanishing and the lenses becoming clear once more. She then gently guides him to a nearby bookshop, where they find the Weasley family standing near the counter, engaged in conversation. A queue of excited customers snakes through the shop, each eagerly clutching a book, waiting for their turn to have it signed. Suddenly, a blond man dressed in a striking blue suit and a matching cloak makes a grand entrance, his presence commanding attention. He smiles smugly, basking in the attention, and poses confidently for the camera. As he scans the crowd, Lockhart's gaze lands on Harry's grubby face, and the photographer, eager for a good shot, pulls Harry forward, causing Ron to pull a face in response. They decide it's time to leave and head for the door. Just then, a boy with very fair hair tears a page from a book and steps directly in front of Harry, blocking his path. A man with long fair hair approaches and, with a sense of authority, touches Harry's forehead with his snake-topped cane. Meanwhile, the Grangers are engaged in a lively chat with Mr. Weasley, who then turns his attention to Ron. He discreetly takes a book from Jenny's cauldron and, with a sleight of hand, slips two books back into it. Mr. Weasley offers a reassuring smile to his children, while Lucius, with a swift motion, turns on his heel. Draco, standing nearby, glares at Ron and Harry with disdain. Later, at King's Cross and Pancras Station, Harry and Louisa hurry along Platform 10, their trolleys loaded with luggage. The twins and Percy, with practiced ease, push their trolleys straight towards the brick wall between the two platforms and, one after the other, disappear through it. Jenny follows suit, and Mr. and Mrs. Weasley make their way towards the wall. On Platform 10, Harry, with Ron close behind, heads for the wall, but instead of passing through, they hit solid brick and collapse in a tangled heap of trolleys and luggage. Hedwig, startled, flaps her wings in agitation. A porter notices the commotion and comes over to assist, while Ron, sitting amidst the chaos, looks thoughtful. Outside the station, the blue Ford Anglia rises unsteadily into the air, catching the attention of a taxi driver who looks up in amazement. Inside the car, Ron presses a button on the dashboard, and high above London, the car suddenly disappears from view. As they soar through the sky, thick clouds gradually part, revealing the low green hills far below. Without warning, the car reappears, and Ron quickly changes gear, steering the car down towards the railway line. They skim just above the track, flying over a magnificent stone viaduct. Looking back, they are horrified to see the Hogwarts Express right behind them. Ron urgently jacks the wheel to the left, causing the car to swerve away from the track and swoop under the viaduct. The car tumbles between the stone arches, turning over and over in a dizzying spiral. In the chaos, the car door flies open, and Harry finds himself falling out, but he manages to grab the door handle just in time, hanging on precariously above the speeding train. Ron stretches down towards him, and Harry, with a desperate reach, grabs Ron's outstretched hand, allowing him to scramble back inside the car. Ron quickly turns the wheel, and the train continues to thunder on beneath them, trailing a plume of white smoke. As darkness falls, the car's headlights illuminate the towers of Hogwarts School in the distance. Ron glances at Harry, but Harry's smile of delight fades as the car engine begins to falter. Ron struggles with the wheel, trying to maintain control as the car swoops erratically, zooming dangerously close to the brightly lit windows of the Great Hall.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
She waves her wand, and Harry's glasses repair themselves. She then takes him to a bookshop where the Weasley family stands near the counter, amidst a queue of excited customers waiting for book signings. A blond man in a blue suit and matching cloak, Lockhart, poses smugly for the camera and notices Harry in the crowd. The photographer pulls Harry forward, prompting Ron to make a face as they head for the door. A boy with very fair hair tears a page from a book and steps in front of Harry, while a man with long fair hair touches Harry's forehead with his snake-topped cane. Meanwhile, the Grangers chat with Mr. Weasley, who takes a book from Jenny's cauldron and discreetly slips two books back into it, smiling reassuringly at his children. Lucius turns on his heel, and Draco glares at Ron and Harry.

At King's Cross and Pancras Station, Harry and Louisa hurry along Platform 10 with loaded trolleys. The twins and Percy push their trolleys through the brick wall between platforms, disappearing one after another, followed by Jenny. Mr. and Mrs. Weasley also head for the wall. On Platform 10, Harry and Ron attempt to follow but hit solid brick, collapsing in a heap of trolleys and luggage as Hedwig flaps her wings. A porter approaches, and Ron looks thoughtful. Outside the station, the blue Ford Anglia rises into the air, astonishing a taxi driver. Ron presses a button on the dashboard, and the car disappears high above London. As the thick cloud clears, revealing low green hills, the car reappears. Ron changes gear and steers the car down towards the railway line, skimming above the track over a stone viaduct. They look back in horror as the Hogwarts Express approaches. Ron swerves the car away from the track, swooping under the viaduct and tumbling between the stone arches. The car door flies open, and Harry falls out but manages to grab the door handle, hanging precariously above the train. Ron stretches down, and Harry grabs his hand, scrambling back inside the car. Ron turns the wheel as the train thunders on beneath a plume of white smoke. As darkness falls, the car's headlights illuminate the towers of Hogwarts School. Ron glances at Harry, whose smile fades as the car engine falters, and Ron struggles with the wheel as the car swoops out of control, zooming close to the brightly lit windows of the Great Hall.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She waves her wand, an act showcasing her proficiency in magic. Harry, who is known for wearing round glasses due to his poor eyesight, blinks as his glasses repair themselves, a testament to the wonders of magical spells. She takes him to a bookshop, Flourish and Blotts, where the Weasley family, known for their red hair and warm demeanor, are standing near the counter. A queue of excited customers are waiting to get their book signed by Gilderoy Lockhart, a famous yet flamboyant wizard author. A blond man with a blue suit and matching cloak, known as Lockhart himself, appears. He smiles smugly, basking in his own celebrity. Posing for the camera, Lockhart spots Harry's grubby face in the crowd, recognizing him as the famous young wizard who defeated Voldemort. The photographer, eager to capture a moment with Harry, pulls him forward. Ron, Harry's loyal best friend, pulls a face. They head for the door. A boy with very fair hair, Draco Malfoy, tears a page from a book, known for his rivalry with Harry. He steps in front of Harry, blocking his way. A man with long fair hair, Lucius Malfoy, touches Harry's forehead with his snake-topped cane, a symbol of the Malfoy family's status and allegiance. The Grangers, who are Hermione's Muggle parents, are chatting to Mr. Weasley, a fan of all things related to the non-magical world. He looks at Ron. He takes a book from Jenny's cauldron, acting nonchalantly. He slips two books back into Jenny's cauldron in a sly manner. Mr. Weasley smiles reassuringly at his children, a sign of his caring nature. Lucius turns on his heel, leaving without further comment. Draco glares at Ron and Harry, intent on antagonizing them. At King's Cross and Pancras Station, a major London railway hub, Harry and Louisa hurry along Platform 10 with loaded trolleys. The twins and Percy, part of the Weasley family, push their trolleys straight towards the brick wall between the two platforms, a magical barrier to Platform 9¾. They disappear through it one after the other. Jenny, the youngest Weasley, follows. Mr. and Mrs. Weasley head for the wall. On Platform 10, Harry heads for the wall with Ron close behind. They hit solid brick, an unusual occurrence hinting at trouble, and collapse in a heap of trolleys and luggage. Hedwig, Harry's loyal snowy owl, flaps her wings in agitation. A porter comes over, concerned about the commotion. Ron looks thoughtful, pondering their predicament. Outside the station, the blue Ford Anglia, enchanted to fly, rises unsteadily into the air. A taxi driver looks up in amazement at the sight of a car defying gravity. Ron presses a button on the dashboard, engaging the car's invisibility booster. High above London, the car disappears from view. Thick cloud gradually clears, revealing low green hills far below, part of the scenic British countryside. The car suddenly reappears. Ron changes gear and steers the car down towards the railway line. They skim above the track over a magnificent stone viaduct, reminiscent of the Glenfinnan Viaduct in Scotland. They look back with horror. The Hogwarts Express, the train taking students to Hogwarts, is right behind them. Ron jacks the wheel to the left. The car swerves away from the track and swoops under the viaduct. It tumbles between the stone arches, turning over and over in a dizzying maneuver. The car door flies open and Harry falls out. Harry, relying on his Seeker reflexes, has managed to grab the door handle. He hangs on precariously above the train. Ron stretches down towards him. Harry reaches desperately for his hand. Harry grabs Ron's outstretched hand and manages to scramble back inside the car. Ron turns the wheel. The train thunders on beneath a plume of white steam, iconic of British steam locomotives. As darkness falls, the car headlights pick out the towers of Hogwarts School, a castle famed for its magical education. Ron glances at Harry. Harry's smile of delight fades as the car engine falters, indicating their reckless flight has taken its toll. Ron struggles with the wheel as the car swoops out of control, zooming close to the brightly lit windows of the Great Hall, where the Hogwarts students dine.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: She waves her wand. Harry blinks as his glasses repair themselves. She takes him to a bookshop where the Weasley family are standing near the counter. A queue of excited customers are waiting to get their book signed. A blond man with a blue suit and matching cloak appears. He smiles smugly. Posing for the camera. Lockhart spots Harry's grubby face in the crowd. The photographer pulls Harry forward. Ron pulls a face. They head for the door. A boy with very fair hair tears a page from a book. He steps in front of Harry. A man with long fair hair touches Harry's forehead with his snaketopped cane. The Grangers are chatting to Mr Weasley. He looks at Ron. He takes a book from Jenny's cauldron. He slips two books back into Jenny's cauldron. Mr Weasley smiles reassuringly at his children. Lucius turns on his heel. Draco glares at Ron and Harry. At King's Cross and Pancras Station Harry and Louisa hurry along Platform 10 with loaded trolleys. The twins and Percy push their trolleys straight towards the brick wall between the two platforms. They disappear through it one after the other. Jenny follows. Mr and Mrs Weasley head for the wall. On Platform 10 Harry heads for the wall with Ron close behind. They hit solid brick. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. They collapse in a heap of trolleys and luggage. Hedwig flaps her wings. A porter comes over. Ron looks thoughtful. Outside the station the blue Ford Anglia rises unsteadily into the air. A taxi driver looks up in amazement. Ron presses a button on the dashboard. High above London the car disappears. Thick cloud gradually clears revealing low green hills far below. The car suddenly reappears. Ron changes gear and steers the car down towards the railway line. They skim above the track over a magnificent stone viaduct. They look back with horror. The Hogwarts Express is right behind them. Ron jacks the wheel to the left. The car swerves away from the track and swoops under the viaduct. It tumbles between the stone arches turning over and over. The car door flies open and Harry falls out. Harry has managed to grab the door handle. He hangs on precariously above the train. Ron stretches down towards him. Harry reaches desperately for his hand. Harry grabs Ron's outstretched hand and manages to scramble back inside the car. Ron turns the wheel. The train thunders on beneath a plume of white smoke. As darkness falls the car headlights pick out the towers of Hogwarts School. Ron glances at Harry. Harry's smile of delight fades as the car engine falters. Ron struggles with the wheel as the car swoops out of control zooming close to the brightly lit windows of the Great Hall.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: She waves her wand. Harry blinks as his glasses repair themselves. She takes him to a bookshop where the Weasley family are standing near the counter. A queue of excited customers are waiting to get their book signed. A blond man with a blue suit and matching cloak appears. He smiles smugly. Posing for the camera. Lockhart spots Harry's grubby face in the crowd. The photographer pulls Harry forward. Ron pulls a face. They head for the door. A boy with very fair hair tears a page from a book. He steps in front of Harry. A man with long fair hair touches Harry's forehead with his snaketopped cane. The Grangers are chatting to Mr Weasley. He looks at Ron. He takes a book from Jenny's cauldron. He slips two books back into Jenny's cauldron. Mr Weasley smiles reassuringly at his children. Lucius turns on his heel. Draco glares at Ron and Harry. At King's Cross and Pancras Station Harry and Louisa hurry along Platform 10 with loaded trolleys. The twins and Percy push their trolleys straight towards the brick wall between the two platforms. They disappear through it one after the other. Jenny follows. Mr and Mrs Weasley head for the wall. On Platform 10 Harry heads for the wall with Ron close behind. They hit solid brick. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She tosses her frisbee. Tom squints as his shoes untie themselves. She whisks him to a bakery where the Anderson family are lounging near the shelf. A line of eager shoppers are waiting to get their pastry toasted. A redhead woman with a yellow gown and matching hat emerges. She grins arrogantly. Posing for the mirror, Betsy spots Tom's dusty shirt in the throng. The baker tugs Tom forward. Sam pulls a grimace. They dash for the exit. A girl with very curly hair rips a piece from a magazine. She struts in front of Tom. A lady with long curly hair pats Tom's chin with her flower-tipped umbrella. The Johnsons are laughing with Mr. Anderson. He glances at Sam. He extracts a cookie from Sarah's basket. He sneaks two muffins back into Sarah's basket. Mr. Anderson nods reassuringly at his children. Karl spins on his toe. Ben scowls at Sam and Tom. At Central and Baker Station, Tom and Lisa hurry along Track 5 with loaded prams. The cousins and Alex steer their prams directly towards the stone fence between the two tracks. They vanish through it one after the other. Sarah trails. Mr. and Mrs. Anderson move for the fence. On Track 5, Tom moves for the fence with Sam close behind. They strike solid stone. They tumble in a heap of prams and parcels. Oliver flaps his wings. A conductor wanders over. Sam looks puzzled. Outside the station, the green Volkswagen Beetle floats unsteadily into the sky. A cyclist looks up in disbelief. Sam clicks a switch on the control panel. High above the city, the car vanishes. Thick fog slowly clears, revealing distant brown fields far below. The car suddenly materializes. Sam shifts gears and guides the car down towards the highway. They glide above the road over a majestic wooden bridge. They peer back with dismay. The Astoria Train is closely behind them. Sam jerks the lever to the right. The car veers away from the road and swoops under the bridge. It spirals between the wooden beams, flipping over and over. The car window bursts open and Tom tumbles out. Tom has managed to clutch the window frame. He dangles precariously above the tracks. Sam reaches down towards him. Tom stretches frantically for his arm. Tom clasps Sam's extended arm and manages to scramble back inside the car. Sam twists the lever. The train roars on beneath a trail of gray steam. As night descends, the car beams illuminate the spires of Carleton College. Sam peers at Tom. Tom's grin of excitement fades as the car motor sputters. Sam fumbles with the lever as the car swoops out of control, darting near the warmly glowing windows of the Dining Hall.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The scene begins with Hermione repairing Harry's glasses. They head to a bookshop with the Weasleys, where Gilderoy Lockhart poses for photos and spots Harry. Draco Malfoy and his father, Lucius, confront Harry and the Weasleys, Lucius slipping books into Jenny's cauldron. At King's Cross Station, the group attempts to access Platform 9¾. The twins and Percy succeed, but Harry and Ron crash into the wall. Afterward, they fly the Ford Anglia, which becomes invisible and later reappears over a viaduct as the Hogwarts Express approaches. In a panic, they navigate around the train, and Harry nearly falls out but is saved by Ron. They regain control, heading towards Hogwarts. As they arrive, the car's engine fails, spiraling out of control near the Great Hall's windows.
